SEARCH
Package io.brane.rpc

Class WebSocketProvider

java.lang.Object
io.brane.rpc.WebSocketProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
BraneProvider, AutoCloseable
public class WebSocketProvider extends Object implements BraneProvider, AutoCloseable
Ultra-low latency WebSocket provider using Netty and LMAX Disruptor. Optimizations: - Zero-allocation JSON serialization directly to ByteBuf - Low-allocation response parsing from ByteBuf - Lock-free request ID generation - Batched writes with flush on end-of-batch - Optimized Netty channel options (TCP_NODELAY, etc.) - Large ring buffer for high throughput bursts

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static WebSocketProvider create(String url)
      Creates a new WebSocketProvider and connects to the specified URL.

      The provider supports both ws:// and wss:// schemes. SSL/TLS is automatically configured for secure connections.

      Parameters:
      url - the WebSocket URL to connect to (e.g., "wss://ethereum.publicnode.com")
      Returns:
      a connected WebSocketProvider instance
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if connection fails

    • send

      public JsonRpcResponse send(String method, List<?> params) throws RpcException
      Sends a synchronous JSON-RPC request and blocks until the response is received.

      This method wraps sendAsync(java.lang.String, java.util.List<?>) and waits for completion. For better performance in high-throughput scenarios, prefer sendAsync(java.lang.String, java.util.List<?>) or sendAsyncBatch(java.lang.String, java.util.List<?>).

      Specified by:
      send in interface BraneProvider
      Parameters:
      method - the JSON-RPC method name (e.g., "eth_blockNumber")
      params - the method parameters, or null/empty for no parameters
      Returns:
      the JSON-RPC response
      Throws:
      RpcException - if the request fails or returns an error

    • sendAsync

      public CompletableFuture<JsonRpcResponse> sendAsync(String method, List<?> params)
      Sends an asynchronous JSON-RPC request.

      The request is serialized directly to a ByteBuf with zero intermediate String allocations. The returned future completes when the response is received.

      For batch scenarios with many concurrent requests, consider using sendAsyncBatch(java.lang.String, java.util.List<?>) which uses the Disruptor for optimal batching.

      Parameters:
      method - the JSON-RPC method name (e.g., "eth_chainId")
      params - the method parameters, or null/empty for no parameters
      Returns:
      a CompletableFuture that completes with the JSON-RPC response

    • sendAsyncBatch

      public CompletableFuture<JsonRpcResponse> sendAsyncBatch(String method, List<?> params)
      Sends an asynchronous JSON-RPC request using the Disruptor ring buffer.

      This method is optimized for high-throughput scenarios where many requests are sent in rapid succession. Requests are batched and flushed together, reducing syscall overhead.

      Use this method when:

      • Sending many requests in a tight loop
      • Maximum throughput is more important than individual request latency
      • You want automatic batching of network writes
      Parameters:
      method - the JSON-RPC method name
      params - the method parameters, or null/empty for no parameters
      Returns:
      a CompletableFuture that completes with the JSON-RPC response

    • subscribe

      public String subscribe(String method, List<?> params, Consumer<Object> callback) throws RpcException
      Subscribes to a real-time event stream using eth_subscribe.

      Supported subscription types include:

      • newHeads - new block headers
      • logs - contract event logs (with optional filter)
      • newPendingTransactions - pending transaction hashes

      The callback is invoked on the Netty I/O thread. Avoid blocking operations in the callback to prevent I/O thread starvation.

      Specified by:
      subscribe in interface BraneProvider
      Parameters:
      method - the subscription type (e.g., "newHeads", "logs")
      params - additional parameters (e.g., log filter for "logs" subscription)
      callback - invoked for each notification with the event data
      Returns:
      the subscription ID, which can be used to unsubscribe(java.lang.String)
      Throws:
      RpcException - if subscription fails

    • unsubscribe

      public boolean unsubscribe(String subscriptionId) throws RpcException
      Unsubscribes from a previously created subscription.
      Specified by:
      unsubscribe in interface BraneProvider
      Parameters:
      subscriptionId - the subscription ID returned by subscribe(java.lang.String, java.util.List<?>, java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Object>)
      Returns:
      true if the subscription was successfully cancelled
      Throws:
      RpcException - if the unsubscribe request fails

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the WebSocket connection and releases all resources.

      This method:

      • Shuts down the Disruptor
      • Closes the WebSocket channel
      • Shuts down the Netty event loop group
      • Fails any pending requests with an exception

      After calling close(), this provider cannot be reused.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
